New Records: The Marlins had their 69th player appear in a game this season and tied a major league record.
Key Match Events: Edward Cabrera pitched seven scoreless innings, allowing only three hits.
Miami ended the major league debut of Philadelphia starter Seth Johnson with a seven-run third inning.
Lake Bachar struck out the side in a perfect eighth inning.
Phillies catcher Garrett Stubbs pitched a scoreless eighth.
Post-Match Reflections: Marlins manager Skip Schumaker expressed satisfaction with splitting the series against a contending team.
Phillies manager Rob Thomson commented on Seth Johnson's performance, noting his struggles with pitch placement.
